result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey D Pratt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges in accordance with jail rules, and may be served in any Wisconsin County pursuant to Wisconsin Statute 303.08(6). Defendant shall report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without any non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance may result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to and comply with any evaluation, assessment, counselling and/or treatment, as deemed appropriate by Agent and shall pay all applicable costs of same

PAYABLE TO DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS, DOC Collect : If probation is revoked, the Probation Officer shall notify the Clerk of Court in writing of any unpaid restitution which shall be reduced to a civil judgment and docketed in the office of the Clerk of Circuit Court for Adams County, Wisconsin.

PAYABLE TO CLERK OF COURT. If not timely paid in full, defendant may be ordered to spend one day in the county jail for each $50.00 amount owed, with huber privileges, and the remaining unpaid obligation will be docketed & enforced as a civil judgment against the defendant. The defendant shall keep the Clerk of Court's office advised of any change of address until the obligation is paid in full.
Defendant shall have no contact with the following named person(s) or their residence(s): MJD

If defendant has not already done so, he/she shall provide a biological specimen to the State Crime Laboratory for deoxyribonucleic acid analysis (DNA testing) pursuant to Section 973.047(1f) Wis. Stats.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges in accordance with jail rules, and may be served in any Wisconsin County pursuant to Wisconsin Statute 303.08(6). Defendant shall report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without any non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance may result in loss of Huber privileges without further process. This jail sentence is stayed and may be lifted by the Court if defendant does not perform well on probation.
